name: JFrogXrayBuildScan
description:
Scan a build with JFrog Xray.
The scanned build must be published to Artifactory prior to scanning, using the 'Publish Build Info' task.
author: JFrog

inputs.name: xrayConnection
inputs.label: Xray service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Xray service to use in the command.

inputs.name: buildName
inputs.label: Build name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build name to scan.
To use the default build name of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.DefinitionName)'.
The build should already be published to Artifactory.

inputs.name: buildNumber
inputs.label: Build number
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Build number to scan.
To use the default build number of the pipeline, set the field to '$(Build.BuildNumber)'.
The build should already be published to Artifactory.

inputs.name: watchesSource
inputs.label: Xray Watches Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the source to obtain Xray watches, to determine Xray's violations creation.

inputs.name: watches
inputs.label: Xray watches list
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma separated list of Xray watches, to determine Xray's violations creation.

inputs.name: project
inputs.label: Artifactory Project key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Artifactory project key that contains the build info.

inputs.name: repo-path
inputs.label: Repository path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target repo path, to enable Xray to determine watches accordingly.

inputs.name: allowFailBuild
inputs.label: Allow fail build
inputs.helpMarkDown: Uncheck if you do not wish to fail the build if Xray scan matches a rule with 'Fail Build' action.

inputs.name: vuln
inputs.label: Show all vulnerabilities
inputs.helpMarkDown: Set to true if you'd like to receive all vulnerabilities, regardless of the policy configured in Xray.
